definition: to miss (bus, train etc)
mistake/error/to miss/to harm/to delay/to neglect/mistakenly
surname Che
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
war chariot (archaic)/rook (in Chinese chess)/rook (in chess)

sentences.english: Had he got up little earlier, he would not have missed the train.
sentences.chinese: 要是他早一点起身的话，他本来可以不误车的。

sentences.english: If you don't hurry, you must miss the train.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不快点，你必然要误车。

sentences.english: Fortunately we didn't miss the bus.
If we had started earlier, we should not have missed the train.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们早一点动身的话，就不会误车了。

sentences.english: We missed the train because you dragged your feet.
sentences.chinese: 就因为你总是拖拖拉拉的，我们才会误车。

sentences.english: The bus company announced that the fog would delay certain routes.
sentences.chinese: 公交公司已经发出通知，大雾将造成部分线路误车。

definition: to miss a plane
not on time/late (public transport, airlines)/overdue/behind schedule/delayed

departure (of a coach or train)/to dispatch a vehicle
to inspect a ticket/to examine a ballot
(of trains etc) late/delayed/behind schedule/light dinner
traffic jam/(of traffic) to get congested

a turntable
